sn2.27:1: Standing to one side, the young deva Nanda recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn2.27:2: v.359"Time flies by, the nights swiftly pass;The stages of life successively desert us.Seeing clearly this danger in death,One should do deeds of merit that bring happiness."
sn2.27:3: v.60"Time flies by, the nights swiftly pass;The stages of life successively desert us.sn.i.6Seeing clearly this danger in death,A seeker of peace should drop the world's bait."
